Posts.Content: No Evidence of Disease (NED). Many good treatments are available for Hormone Responsive BC. I am on IBrance and Faslodex for my Er-Pr Her2 negative breast cancer. I get a diagnostic CT Scan or Pet Scan to monitor my NED status. Best wishes to you and your daughter! Moo1
Posts.Title: Cutting edge treatments and clinical trials for Stage IV Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: Some of us stage 4 metastatic BC have been on various protocols until they stop working! I ‘ve tried them all, but have been on IBrance/ Faslodex since February 2016 with good results. I’m due for scans in early June so I “pray hard” that I It is still working. I do have fatigue, some joint and muscle pain, but feel it’s a small price to pay if It keeps me stable! Like all of you, I worry when the “ other shoe will drop” and fear each 6 month scan result. Hopefully, those of us on the IBrance/Faslodex train can keep riding! I pray for us all! Moo1
Posts.Title: Faslodex and IBrance

Posts.Content: Yeah, I have the nagging cough. Started with the IBrance! I also have a mucous overload that promotes the coughing and a chronically plugged left ear! Tried allergy tabs and Flonase nasal spray. Finally, Pulmonologist prescribed Proventil to control the cough! It’s just an annoying side effect of the treatment unless your scan shows more than inflammation. Wishing you well! Moo1
Posts.Title: Coughing
